messages.message:
Catching up on this. Thanks @Jessica for clarifying that community users couldn't build integrations! Reminds me why we never built that migration path. For commercial users, we very intentionally built a migration from app based to deployment based to ensure a smooth transfer. That said, we definitely could have communicated this better. In the future we could do something like:
• Provide a warning in release(s) ahead that integrations for apps would no longer be supported and to use deployments
• When deployments were live, provided a stronger warning that integrations would need to be migrated to deployments and how a user could do this
cc: @melissa.amos for us to think through next time. Outside of release notes communication, I'm weary of taking on any additional customer communication expectations.

@Ben Wood could you clarify what behavior the user saw here? Did they not see the migration path, or did something go wrong with it? Or were they upset that they had to migrate in the first place, and considered that broken?
